{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3362075,"name":"brian smith","username":"isubsmith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-14T23:10:15.359Z","cooked":"

I’m trying to make a PID tunning shuffleboard tab to make it a bit easier to tune some of our PID systems. I have plenty of experience with shuffleboard in general and haven’t had a problem with any other widgets.

I made a “tuning” tab and added 8 PIDCommand widgets to the tab. For some reason, only the last one shows up. If I comment it out, the 2nd one shows up instead, along with one of the other Graph widgets I have.

I’m confused about what’s going on. Can you only have one PIDCommand per tab or something?

Here’s the code snippet:

tuningTab.add(“Launcher RPM”,0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kGraph).withSize(3,3).withPosition(0,4);

tuningTab.add("Wrist PID",          0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(0,0);
tuningTab.add("Elevator PID",       0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(2,0);
tuningTab.add("Launcher LM PID",    0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(4,0);
tuningTab.add("Launcher RM PID",    0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(6,0);

tuningTab.add("Drive PID",          0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(0,2);
tuningTab.add("Turn PID",           0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(2,2);
tuningTab.add("Holonomic Turn PID", 0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(6,2);
tuningTab.add("Holonomic Drive PID",0).withWidget(BuiltInWidgets.kPIDCommand).withSize(2,3).withPosition(4,2);

Only the Holonomic Drive PID widget shows up (nothing else). If I comment that out, the Elevator PID widget shows up, as does the RPM graph but nothing else.

I haven’t hooked any of this code to the subsystems in question yet, I was just working on the GUI first.

If it matters for some reason, I’m doing this in simulation (not connected to the real robot) with SimGui, then launching Shuffleboard manually. I’ve done this plenty in the past with no issues.

Thanks.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-14T23:10:15.359Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":80,"readers_count":79,"score":66.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462759,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab","display_username":"brian smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51275,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab/462759/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3362437,"name":null,"username":"Starlight220","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-15T04:54:14.180Z","cooked":"

If you remove the withSize().withPosition()s and let Shuffleboard place everything automatically, does everything appear?
Also, does the data being sent fulfill the needed fields? If Shuffleboard can’t parse the data properly, I wouldn’t be surprised if it causes issues. You can also look at Shuffleboard’s logs (~/Shuffleboard/logs iirc) to see if there are missing field errors.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-15T04:54:14.180Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462759,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab","display_username":null,"primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":45763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6738a | ISR | WPILib"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab/462759/2","custom_user_title":"6738a | ISR | WPILib","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3362496,"name":"brian smith","username":"isubsmith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-15T09:49:56.392Z","cooked":"

I tried that actually. It just puts the holonomic drive PID widget at 0,0 and no other widgets show up.

Thanks for info on the log files. I didn’t know those were generated. There is an uncaught exception but I’m not sure what to make of it.
WARNING: Uncaught exception on JavaFX Application Thread edu.wpi.first.shuffleboard.api.data.IncompatibleSourceException: Expected one of (PIDCommand), but found type Number instead

There’s only one exception (I am surprised there isn’t one per PIDCommand). I’m guessing setting an initial/default value for the PIDCommand of 0 is the problem. I might try connecting the real subsystem PIDs instead and see if that helps.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-15T09:49:56.392Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":45,"readers_count":44,"score":14.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462759,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab","display_username":"brian smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":45763,"username":"Starlight220","name":null,"avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/starlight220/{size}/150872_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51275,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab/462759/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3362575,"name":"Sam Carlberg","username":"SamCarlberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/samcarlberg/{size}/207684_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-15T12:40:24.122Z","cooked":"
isubsmith:

I’m guessing setting an initial/default value for the PIDCommand of 0 is the problem.

That’s correct. Why were you trying this in the first place?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-15T12:40:24.122Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":35,"readers_count":34,"score":12.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462759,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab","display_username":"Sam Carlberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25916,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2084 Lead Mentor | WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab/462759/4","custom_user_title":"2084 Lead Mentor | WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3362585,"name":"brian smith","username":"isubsmith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-15T12:53:51.948Z","cooked":"

I build the shuffleboard tabs in RobotContainer and then grab the widgets/network table entries in the various subsystems and connect real code there. This works fine for all the other widgets so I was hoping it would work for PIDCommand.
Thanks

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-15T12:53:51.948Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":32,"readers_count":31,"score":6.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":462759,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab","display_username":"brian smith","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":25916,"username":"SamCarlberg","name":"Sam Carlberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/samcarlberg/{size}/207684_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51275,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab/462759/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3362591,"name":"Sam Carlberg","username":"SamCarlberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/samcarlberg/{size}/207684_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-15T13:00:09.512Z","cooked":"

That’ll work as long as you set up the widgets with the correct data. I typically recommend either building the shuffleboard tabs directly in robotcontainer, pulling data/commands/sendables from the subsystems there, or building the tabs individually in each subsystem. Doing it split can lead to the issues you’re encountering

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-04-15T13:00:09.512Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":31,"readers_count":30,"score":21.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":462759,"topic_slug":"shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab","display_username":"Sam Carlberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25916,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2084 Lead Mentor | WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/shuffleboard-pidcommand-widgets-only-one-shows-up-on-a-tab/462759/6","custom_user_title":"2084 Lead Mentor | WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3362687,"name":"brian smith","username":"isubsmith","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/7feea3/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-15T14:34:50.315Z","cooked":"

Yeah, I think I’ll build the tab in RobotContainer and create the widgets I can there (e.g. a few graphs and number sliders) and then create the PIDCommand widgets in the subsystems.

Could I create a dummy PIDCommand in RobotContainer for the default value argument and pass it to the 8 different PIDCommand widgets, then change them later in the subsystems maybe?

isubsmith:

Could I create a dummy PIDCommand in RobotContainer for the default value argument and pass it to the 8 different PIDCommand widgets, then change them later in the subsystems maybe?

What would be gained by this over just creating the widgets directly from the subsystems?

It just keeps all my shuffleboard construction in one place which might be nice. That’s mostly it.
